grid.label: Brewery openings
grid.title: Brewery boom
grid.chatter: After Dayton signed the “Surly Bill” into law in 2011, which opened the door for brewers to serve beer on site, the number of craft breweries in the state exploded.

grid.label: New business filings
grid.title: Boom in business filings
grid.chatter: The number of new business filings in Minnesota each year has increased significantly are a post-recession slump.

grid.label: Foreign-born population
grid.title: Increased immigrant population
grid.chatter: Minnesota's foreign-born population has steadily increased over the years.
grid.source: U.S. Census Bureau, Minnesota State Demographic Center

grid.label: Population of color
grid.title: A diversifying state
grid.chatter: Minnesota's population of color has steadily increased over the years.
grid.source: U.S. Census Bureau, Minnesota State Demographic Center

grid.label: Wolf population
grid.title: Stabilized wolf population
grid.chatter: Since the Minnesota DNR began conducting annual wolf population estimates in 2005, the number of wolves in the state has stabilized in the last few years after falling significantly in the previous decade.

grid.label: Broadband access
grid.title: Increasing broadband Internet access
grid.chatter: The percentage of Minnesota households with access to high-speed broadband Internet has steadily increased due to efforts to improve connectivity across the state, including from the Governor's Task Force on Broadband.
grid.source: Minnesota DEED, Connected Nationa, Governor's Taskforce on Broadband

grid.label: Median income
grid.title: Median household income
grid.chatter: Minnesota's median household income reached a low point following the Great Recession but has been rebounding since.

grid.label: U 4-year graduation rate
grid.title: University of Minnesota four-year graduation rate
grid.chatter: The University of Minnesota's four-year graduation rate has been gradually improving over time.
grid.source: University of Minnesota Office of Institutional Research

grid.label: Walleye population
grid.title: Rebounding walleye population
grid.chatter: The walleye population of Lake Mille Lacs has been a hot political topic in Minnesota during Dayton’s tenure. Minnesota’s DNR has allowed catch-and-release fishing only for state-licensed anglers for the past three summers, to allow the walleye population to rebuild.

grid.label: Jobs
grid.title: Steady increases in available jobs
grid.chatter: The total nonfarm payroll jobs in Minnesota has gradually risen since the end of the Great Recession.

grid.label: Good roads
grid.title: Improvements to road quality
grid.chatter: The average percentage of roadways rated as having good ride quality by MNDOT has increased after some years of stagnation.

grid.label: Public health insurance
grid.title: More use of public health insurance
grid.chatter: The percentage of Minnesotans with health insurance from a public provider has increased in the passage of the Affordable Care Act.

grid.label: Incarceration rate
grid.title: Minnesota state prison incarceration rate
grid.chatter: Minnesota's state prison incarceration rate per 100,000 residents has been rising steadily for years, even after a slight decrease near the beginning of Dayton's administration.

grid.label: Traffic delay hours
grid.title: Increasing hours in traffic
grid.chatter: The hours spent by commuters in traffic each year was rising before stabilizing in the Pawlenty years, and has remained somewhat flat.
grid.source: Texas A&M Transportation Institute, Urban Mobility Scorecard

grid.label: Metro population
grid.title: Booming metro population
grid.chatter: The population of the Twin Cities metro area has been steadily increasing.
grid.source: U.S. Census Bureau, Minnesota State Demographic Center

grid.label: Graduation rate
grid.title: Rising high school graduation rates
grid.chatter: Minnesota's overall high school graduation rate has been gradually increasing.

grid.label: Math proficiency
grid.title: Stagnant rates of math proficiency
grid.chatter: The percentage Minnesota eighth graders achieving math standards has been relatively flat since 2011.

grid.label: Adults working
grid.title: Stabilized percent of adults in workforce
grid.chatter: The percentage of Minnesota adults aged 16 to 64 in the workforce dipped during the Great Recession before rebounding.

grid.label: College degrees
grid.title: More college-educated Minnesotans
grid.chatter: The percentageof Minnesotans with a bachelor's degree or higher has increased steadily over the years.

grid.label: U tuition
grid.title: Climbing University tuition
grid.chatter: In-state resident tuition (in 2016 dollars) at the University of Minnesota had been increasing steadily until a tuition freeze deal with the Legislature in 2013.
grid.source: University of Minnesota Office of Institutional Research

grid.label: Obesity
grid.title: Stagnant statewide obesity
grid.chatter: The percentage of Minnesotans older than 19 who are obese has remained relatively flat in recent years.
grid.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

grid.label: Outstate population
grid.title: Less growth in Greater Minnesota
grid.chatter: Population growth in Greater Minnesota's rural and outstate areas has been more stagnant than the metro area the last couple decades.
grid.source: U.S. Census Bureau, Minnesota State Demographic Center

grid.label: Open enrollment
grid.title: More students using open enrollment
grid.chatter: Since the introduction of open enrollment in Minnesota's schools back in 1993, the percentage of students attending districts outside of their own has gradually increased.

grid.label: Median age
grid.title: A gradually aging state
grid.chatter: Minnesota's median age has slightly increased over the years.
grid.source: U.S. Census Bureau, Minnesota State Demographic Center

grid.label: Diabetes
grid.title: Stagnant diabetes diagnoses
grid.chatter: The percentage of Minnesotans older than 19 who are diagnosed with diabetes has remained relatively flat over the years.
grid.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

grid.label: Six-year graduation rate
grid.title: Increased college graduation rate
grid.chatter: The six-year graduation rate at Minnesota's colleges and universities has gradually increased over time.

grid.label: Educational spending
grid.title: Stagnant state school funding
grid.chatter: The percentage of school funding coming from the state has remained fairly stagnant over the years.

grid.label: GDP
grid.title: Rebounding state GDP
grid.chatter: Minnesota's annual change in gross domestic product bounced back after the Great Recession but has stayed flatter since.

grid.label: Greenhouse emissions
grid.title: Greenhouse emissions reductions
grid.chatter: As measured in tons, greenhouse gas emissions hasn't significantly declined statewide since 2011.

grid.label: Reading proficiency
grid.title: Stagnant rates reading proficiency
grid.chatter: The percentage Minnesota third graders achieving reading standards has been relatively flat since 2013.

grid.label: U enrollment
grid.title: Steady University of Minnesota enrollment
grid.chatter: The University of Minnesota's fall semester enrollment has remained steady over time.
grid.source: University of Minnesota Office of Institutional Research

grid.label: Undergraduate loans
grid.title: Stabilized undergraduate loans
grid.chatter: The cumulative total of undergraduate student loans (in 2016 dollars) in Minnesota had been climbing steadily for years before declining and flattening toward the end of Pawlenty's administration.

grid.label: Volunteerism
grid.title: Declines in volunteerism
grid.chatter: The percentage of Minnesotans aged 16 or older who volunteed in the past year has declined over the years.
grid.source: U.S. Census Bureau, Minnesota State Demographic Center

grid.label: Poverty
grid.title: Declining poverty
grid.chatter: The percentage of Minnesotans in poverty was rising for awhile before starting a decline after the Great Recession.

grid.label: Disabled elderly
grid.title: Slight decline in elderly disabilities
grid.chatter: Thepercentage of Minnesotans aged 65 or older with a disability has slowly declined.

grid.label: Homeownership gap
grid.title: Reduced homeownership gap
grid.chatter: The homeownership gap – the percent difference between white residents and those of color who own homes – increased during the Great Recession before leveling off.

grid.label: Traffic casualties
grid.title: Fewer traffic injuries and fatalities
grid.chatter: The rate of traffic injuries and fatalities per 100,000 residents has declined in Minnesota the past couple decades.
grid.source: Minnesota Department of Public Safety, National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, U.S. Census Bureau

grid.label: Poor highways
grid.title: Fewer miles of poor highways
grid.chatter: The percentage of highways rated as having poor ride quality by MNDOT has gradually decreased.

grid.label: Homelessness
grid.title: Increases in homelessness
grid.chatter: The number of Minnesotans experiencing homelessness has increased over the years, but has seen a slight decline recently.

grid.label: Traffic over bad bridges
grid.title: Less traffic over deficient bridges
grid.chatter: The percentage of urban traffic traveling over structurally deficient bridges in Minnesota has decreased significantly since the collapse of the 35W Bridge.

grid.label: Health uninsurance rate
grid.title: Declining health uninsurance rate
grid.chatter: Minnesota's health uninsurance rate has dropped since the 2009 federal passage of the Affordable Care Act.

grid.label: Congested lane miles
grid.title: Less traffic congestion
grid.chatter: The percentage of Twin Cities lane miles congested during rush hour has slightly decreased over time.
grid.source: Texas A&M Transportation Institute, Urban Mobility Scorecard

grid.label: Cost-burdened housing
grid.title: Reductions in cost-burdened housing
grid.chatter: The share of cost-burdened Minnesota households paying 30 percent or more of their income on housing costs swelled over the Pawlenty administration before gradually declining under Dayton.

grid.label: Mental health admissions
grid.title: Mental health admissions
grid.chatter: The rate of psychiatric hospital admissions per 1,000 Minnesotans aged older than 13 has slightly decreased over the years.
grid.source: Minnesota Hospital Association, National Center for Health Statistics

grid.label: Crime rate
grid.title: Plummeting crime rates
grid.chatter: Minnesota's statewide crime rate per 100,000 residents has fallen steadily over the past two decades.

grid.label: River pollution
grid.title: Fluctuating amounts of river pollution
grid.chatter: Levels of phosphorous pollution by metric tonnage in the Mississippi and Minnesota rivers has has slightly decreased over the past set of five-year averages.

grid.label: Moose population
grid.title: Stabilized moose population
grid.chatter: Minnesota’s moose population is stable after a decade-long decline, but shows no signs of recovery, according to the Minnesota DNR’s aerial moose survey, which has been conducted annually in northeastern Minnesota since 2013.

grid.label: Unemployment rate
grid.title: Plummeting unemployment
grid.chatter: Minnesota's unemployment rate has declined drastically since the end of the Great Recession in 2009.

grid.label: White unemployment
grid.title: Crashing white unemployment
grid.chatter: Unemployment rates among Minnesota's white population has decreased significantly since the end of the Great Recession.

grid.label: Black unemployment
grid.title: Crashing black unemployment
grid.chatter: Unemployment rates among Minnesota's black population has decreased significantly since the end of the Great Recession.

grid.label: Hispanic unemployment
grid.title: Crashing Hispanic unemployment
grid.chatter: Unemployment rates among Minnesota's Hispanic population has decreased significantly since the end of the Great Recession.

grid.label: State budget forecasts
grid.title: From deficit to surplus
grid.chatter: The Pawlenty years were characterized by significant state government budget forecasts transitioned from deficits to surpluses during the Dayton administration. The incoming governor, Tim Walz, will inherit a $1.5 billion budget surplus.
grid.source: Minnesota Management and Budget | Note: uses November forecasts from each year
